bill_title: establish a tuition reimbursement program for certain teachers who teach in rural school districts.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a tuition reimbursement program for certain teachers who teach in rural school districts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Eligible teacher," a teacher who teaches in a rural school district, whose first year of teaching is after the 2016-2017 school year, who graduated from an accredited postsecondary institution located in South Dakota, and who complies with the provisions of this Act; (2) "Postsecondary tuition and fees," the tuition and generally applicable fees for thirty credit hours per year at a postsecondary institution under the control of the Board of Regents as of July 1, 2017; (3) "Rural school district," a school district located in a community with a population of ten thousand persons or less. Section 2. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The Department of Education shall establish a tuition reimbursement program for teachers to assist rural school districts in recruiting teachers. The department shall select up to twenty eligible teachers each year to participate in the tuition reimbursement program. Section 3. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Following an eligible teacher's third year of teaching in a rural school district, the teacher shall receive reimbursement for four years of postsecondary tuition and fees. The Department of Education shall reimburse the teacher from funds appropriated by the Legislature for that purpose. Section 4. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The Department of Education shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish procedures for eligible teachers to apply for tuition reimbursement, for the selection of eligible teachers to participate in the program, and for the distribution of reimbursement funds.
